Articles.Content:
Been playing around with the game since the beginning of March off and on as I can! Been real fun! I so far have two manned landings on both kerbin's moons. An unmaned rover on Duna and Eve, a space station in orbit (my first docking experience was a 5 hour nightmare), etc.. Im new and Im sure you guys have all done this before.

My new thing is making an unmanned ariel drone that can take off from the runway and get into orbit. Finally accomplished this lastnight, but I have I have very little fuel left to really do anything else with. Still working on this.. Its too bad the game doesnt give you more science points for unmanned things. Making probes is kinda fun actually.

Hello! Welcome aboard! We hope you will enjoy your stay!

Glad you're enjoying the game like we do.

I started playing somewhere in the beginning of March too- Althought I haven't landed legitly on Duna and Eve yet.

Good job on getting your SSTO Ariel Drone into orbit! ^^

Happy launching!

G'day. Welcome to the forum. Hope you enjoy your time both here and in-game. If you need a hand with anything be sure to have a look in the tutorial section, or if that does't help, you can ask your question in the gameplay questions section. See ya 'round.

Hi I'm not that new!

By the way, where's Cpt. Skunky.He always said "happy launchings" to new people... I miss that.....

Hello! Welcome aboard! We hope you will enjoy your stay!

Glad you're enjoying the game like we do.

I started playing somewhere in the beginning of March too- Althought I haven't landed legitly on Duna and Eve yet.

Good job on getting your SSTO Ariel Drone into orbit! ^^

Happy launching!

Actually I had a great break threw lastnight with a design. I was able to take it off from the run way, get it into orbit at far out as 200k (where my station is), and then being able to de-orbit and land... Man what a great feeling that was! Missed the right part of the planet with the run way and landed somewhere in the desert, but the fact that it launched with no boosters, got into orbit, and still was able to land was a great feeling. No science points for recovering the vehicle, but eh, whatcha gonna do.

Thank you and to everyone else for the welcome!

You're welcome and that's awesome!
